title: Industrialization in Japan and Soviet Union

content.prompt: Japan’s industrialization during the Meiji period and the Soviet Union’s industrialization during the 1920s and 1930s had which of the following characteristics in common?

choices.label: Industrialization in both countries was achieved largely through state direction rather than through private initiative.
Both governments aimed to maintain women’s inferior status while continuing to work on making economic progress.
Foreign investment capital financed both industrialization programs.
The working classes of both countries began to rebel against poor working conditions and to join political parties.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
